title: How to fix the error 'USB drive is not recognized' in Windows 7 - Quora

response.answer_text: Mostly this problem comes when your OS doesn't have those drivers which is required to run your connected device. I’m covering your query in two Situations : *Situation 1 - If your USB device is a mobile/Smartphone then mostly latest ones automatically identified by the OS as Media device and no problem will be there transferring data between them. But if your device is older then you’ll definitely need a driver to create a interface between your device and your OS. Solution - Search for your mobile/Smartphone drivers on your product manufacturer’s website and download it, install it and then try to connect again. *Situation 2 - If your device is a UFD (USB flash drive). Usually UFD doesn't requires any specific driver to install additionally on computer. Solution - If your device is a UFD (USB Flash drive) then try to connect it to other USB port of your computer. If you have doubt whether your computer’s USB port are damaged then to confirm the problem just try connecting different USB devices to your computer’s USB ports and If none of them will work then definitely your computer’s USB ports are damaged and you’ll need to replace them by your own or from your reliable computer shop.  I hope this might help you :) Feel free to ask!! Thanks for asking!

For USB recognition, it must be uninstalled in the control panel, go to hadware and sounds, then, in universal series, after this process Windows should recognize your device, in any case, the USB is broken or the ports would be defective. If it does not work on your PC, it is necessary to test it on another PC or laptop to rule out if the fault is in the computer or USB device, this video could help you with the problem USB Device Not Recognized on Windows 10/7/8?
